title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

notes: Slight decrease in performance. Alt-tab doesn't work in fullscreen mode. Sometimes process doesn't stop after game close.

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD
notes: 45-50 FPS on Medium settings, 30-40 FPS on High, overall very smooth. Unable to alt-tab out of game in default fullscreen mode, borderless windowed fixes this issue.

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD
notes: Runs well, However I encountered a weird (although mostly unnoticeable) graphics glitch when ALT Tabbing out and back in.

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD
notes: The game locks up after a seemingly random amount of time, which also can cause a full OS lockup. Turning on vsync, limiting FPS to 60, and playing in windowed mode make the lockups less frequent.

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD
notes: Works great, stable 60fps

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD
notes: I get about ~75% of the performance I get in windows. Need to play in borderless windowed or windowed because fullscreen will crash if you alt+tab. Game froze once when changing graphics options.

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD
notes: Disable Subsurface Scattering & Screen Space Reflection. SH Diffuse Quality set to low. 60FPS @ 1080p (except for heavy particle effect scenes)

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD
notes: Played 2+ hours with no crash, maybe a 10% loss in frames vs windows

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD
notes: Frame rate is a bit lower than native, more prone to abrupt drops.  HOWEVER, the big problem is mouse input.  If played with frame rate locked to 60fps or unlimited, mouse input is delayed to the point of being unusable.  A workaround is to lock frame rate to 30fps in settings, which makes it playable again.  Haven't encountered this in Windows, but the game has strange mouse handling (possibly some kind of mouse->joystick emulation) so it's not surprising it's having issues here.

title: Monster Hunter: World
notes: 2560x1440 Max settings with volumetric lighting on high - 35-60fps. VERY smooth. The game did crash repeatedly on the initial desert stage (Barroth battle) but yesterday's mesa update seems to have allowed me to complete that quest.

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD
notes: Alt+tab and Alt+Enter do not work, the performance is okay

title: Monster Hunter: World
notes: Noticed this wasn't reported yet: in-game tutorial movies (where you click "Y" to play an embedded video) cause the game to crash.

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD
notes: First start flickered for a few moments until settling in a window. Switching to bordered window mode fixed that. Input is noticeably delayed but not by too much (very playable). Alt-tabbing for a few minutes caused my system to lock up and it took me several minutes to kill the task (might be a fluke?)

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD
notes: First time run has to be through the steam runtime or denuvo will say it can't connect to the server. (Also doesn't work with bumblebee, but that's to be expected since bumblebee doesn't have vulkan support) Afterwards works fire with native runtime.
Runs out-of-the-box without tweaks. Lower performance than on native Windows, lower settings allow >60FPS. No vibration on controller.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

notes: Tested the first open world area (hits performance hard even on Windows). Performance is around 20-30% worse using SteamPlay compared to Windows 10, but no other noticeable graphical glitches once nVidia drivers were updated. Very bad input lag when using mouse, but as others have said mouse control is bizarre in this game anyway. Playable, if you dont mind the low framerate.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

notes: Game runs perfect in terms of any glitches or weird graphical occurances. 60 fps is not achievable without some major cuts on 1080p for me, mostly because the game already plays rather poor on windows. It's about 15-20 frames slower than my windows 7 install.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

notes: No real problems, but the performance is awful. With the settings cranked up, I averaged 23 fps running around in an expedition, compared to 87 fps on windows. Even turning down all the settings only gets me a few more fps. It's almost playable on my machine, but combat hits it far too hard.

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

notes: Sometimes game freezes randomly. It can happen after 5 minutes or after 20h. It's a game related bug, but there is no fix for Linux atm, only for Windows. Also there is a problem with tutorial videos and cutscene after last boss. Game uses windows media feature pack and I was unable to install it on linux. 300h in this game I can recommend it for Linux.

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

notes: Runs for me without any tweaking. I expect to find a few issues down the line as I play the game. This game hammers even the best rig running Windows. As has been said, expect anywhere between 10 - 20fps lower than windows. This laptop handles the game OK under Windows. Linux causes me to use the lowest settings and for me the screen resoloution cannot be adjusted, unless you want to play in a smaller windowed mode or drop your desktop resolution before starting else you just get a black screen until you hit ALT + ENTER. These reasons for me take it from Platinum to Gold rating.

title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

notes: The game runs with a minor performance hit, but is otherwise fine for the majority of play.  However, after about a half hour of play, it will often freeze and lock up the entire OS mid-mission.  Given how long hunts are, this is extraordinarily frustrating.  It happens so regularly that I can't recommend playing the game on Proton if Windows is an option.  I haven't found a fix or workaround yet.  I'm told that you can avoid having to restart your machine if you use a second computer to SSH in and kill the process.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

notes: Mostly click-and-play, although with harsh GPU-related performance penalties compared to native. Nvidia users are currently plagued with random full system lockups, but Radeon users seem to be fine (albeit with a couple of odd mostly-ignorable graphical bugs on some surfaces in the hub).
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD

notes: There is a problem on Nvidia hardware only that causes the game to lock up after 10-30 minutes of playtime. This doesn't always happen, but it happens about every other time the game is run. This can cause a full system lock up as well. Other than the lock up the game runs perfectly, but nothing that I have tried has cured the lock up. I have tried disabling Esync, spoofing the graphics card to show as an AMD card, multiple driver versions, and multiple proton versions. Unfortunately the lock up has never gone away.
title: MONSTER HUNTER: WORLD
